wiki.content:
The Geto Boys' popularity was boosted somewhat in 1999 by the prominent use of two songs—"Damn it Feels Good to Be a Gangsta" (released as a promotional single for the 1992 compilation album Uncut Dope]) and "Still" (from The Resurrection)—in Mike Judge's film Office Space, now considered a cult classic. 
        
User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License and may also be available under the GNU FDL.
wiki.summary: The Geto Boys' popularity was boosted somewhat in 1999 by the prominent use of two songs—"Damn it Feels Good to Be a Gangsta" (released as a promotional single for the 1992 compilation album Uncut Dope]) and "Still" (from The Resurrection)—in Mike Judge's film Office Space, now considered a cult classic.

track.name: Damn It Feels Good To Be A Gangsta
comments: this is some OG shit brings back a lot of memories
Damn Good
best track ever, dam it feels good to be a G

Although I was born in Jamaica, now I'm in the U.S. making deals, damn it feels good to be a gangsta, I mean one that you don't really know - ridin' around town in a drop top Benz, hittin' switches in my black 64. [3]
DAMN IT FEELZ GOOD
good shit
i second that emotion vietmoneys
@ VietMoneys - this shit is on repeat in Obama's head ALL day.  Promise.
@ vietmoneys, Every god damned day.
How many times a day do you think Obama listens to this?
My anthem
Orioles sweep the Red Sox in Boston? Damn it feels good to be a gangsta.
Sure does.
Real gangsta-ass niggas don't run for shit, cause real gangsta-ass niggas can't run fast
Damn  deez shits dope
I only think of that movie office space.
One of the best things ever made in pop music. Proud to have it in my Top 10.

Although I was born in Jamaica, now I'm in the U.S. making deals, damn it feels good to be a gangsta, I mean one that you don't really know - ridin' around town in a drop top Benz, hittin' switches in my black 64. [2]

Although I was born in Jamaica, now I'm in the U.S. making deals, damn it feels good to be a gangsta, I mean one that you don't really know - ridin' around town in a drop top Benz, hittin' switches in my black 64.
Damn it feels good to be a gangsta, feedin the poor and helpin out with their bills....
